head.title: Arts, Briefly; Atlanta Symphony's Second Amphitheater

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; Atlanta Symphony's Second Amphitheater

body.head.byline: By BEN SISARIO; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

abstract.p: Atlanta Symphony Orchestra will open $35 million, 12,000-seat amphitheare Encore Park for the Arts (S)

block.p: The Atlanta Symphony Orchestra will open a $35 million, 12,000-seat amphitheater on 45 acres in Alpharetta, Ga., about 25 miles north of Atlanta, the orchestra announced. The new amphitheater, the Encore Park for the Arts, is to open in summer 2008. It will be owned by the Woodruff Arts Center, where the orchestra performs in Atlanta, and is to eventually include a visual arts complex and education center. The orchestra will present summer concerts at its current home, the Chastain Park Amphitheater in Atlanta, as well as at the new site.

The orchestra will present summer concerts at its current home, the Chastain Park Amphitheater in Atlanta, as well as at the new site.
